title: NUSAAKSARA: A Multimodal and Multilingual Benchmark for Preserving Indonesian Indigenous Scripts
author: Muhammad Farid Adilazuarda (MBZUAI), Musa Izzanardi Wijanarko (Monash University Indonesia), Lucky Susanto (Monash University Indonesia), Khumaisa Nur'aini (Monash University Indonesia), Derry Wijaya (Monash University Indonesia), Alham Fikri Aji (MBZUAI), ...
relevance_why: This paper focuses on preserving underrepresented languages and their scripts, which could inform methodologies for audio transcription and contextual understanding in multimodal settings.
background: The paper presents a benchmark dataset aimed at preserving Indonesian indigenous scripts through various multimodal tasks including segmentation, optical character recognition, and translation.
contribution: NUSAAKSARA introduces a comprehensive benchmark that integrates local scripts across Indonesian languages to address the underrepresentation of these scripts in natural language processing tasks.
technical_comparison: Previous methods primarily utilized romanized datasets, which limited the representation of local scripts. This work enhances performance by incorporating authentic indigenous scripts and diverse tasks.
key_innovation: Utilizes a mix of human expertise and modern NLP techniques to build a dataset dedicated to indigenous scripts, which are often neglected in existing natural language processing frameworks.
real_world_impact: The dataset can serve as a critical resource for researchers and practitioners aiming to develop NLP applications that promote linguistic diversity and cultural preservation. It may positively influence educational initiatives in Indonesia.
limitations: The dataset only includes eight of the twenty recognized local scripts, and lacks Unicode support for some scripts, notably Lampung, which complicates transcription tasks.

new_terms.aksara: **Aksara** is an Indonesian term that refers to the letters or characters used in various writing systems.
new_terms.OCR: **Optical Character Recognition** is a technology used to convert different types of documents, such as scanned paper documents and images captured by a digital camera, into editable and searchable data.

open_sourcing: We release our benchmark dataset in huggingface [https://huggingface.co/datasets/NusaAksara/NusaAksara]
